content.text: Walking independently begins by walking around an object. With time the infant is gaining a sense of confidence in his walk because his sense of balance  is improving with time and practice.
A balanced and stable walk is the basis for advanced movements like jumping, running and climbing.

If you are seeing that your baby is having a hard time achieving the specific milestones described,  or  is at the age of 15 month and canâ€™t do these  things  you  might want to consult with a pediatric or an Infant development guide in order to learn why and learn how to help your baby to achieve these important abilities that are the foundation of their physical, sensory and emotional needs:

ul: Walking for 2 month but still his walking is global and looks like he is not comfortable.
Feet are turning in or out and not straight/Club Foot
Walking with his back bending forward and the knees are bending
